intro: Cadetia macroloba, commonly known as the large-leaf cadetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant features basal leaves that are large, lobed, and hairy, with stems that are upright and branched. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
